meanings.definition: A type of liturgical vestment worn by deacons and priests.
meanings.sent1: During the church service, the deacon wore dalmatics.
meanings.sent2: The priest carefully folded his dalmatics after the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The dalmatics looked like colorful robes for the church leaders.
meanings.sent4: The dalmatics symbolized the sacred role of the clergy.
meanings.sent5: The intricate designs on the dalmatics caught everyone's attention.

meanings.sent1: In the museum, there were many ancient dalmatics on display.
meanings.sent2: The collection included various styles of dalmatics from different eras.
meanings.sent3: The tailor mistakenly sewed extra buttons on the dalmatics.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with the vibrant colors of the dalmatics.
meanings.sent5: The dalmatics hung gracefully on the mannequins, showcasing their beauty.
